head.title: Welcome to PSP's Distance Learning Opportunities – Distance Learning (March 16 - April 24) – Perry Street Preparatory Public Charter School

meta.name: description
meta.content: Perry Street Preparatory Public Charter School, located in NE D.C., serves students in PreK-grade 12.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Perry Street Preparatory Public Charter School, Perry Street Prep Charter School, Perry Street Prep, Perry Street Charter School

a.span: Perry Street Preparatory Public Charter School

img.h1: Welcome to PSP's Distance Learning Opportunities

p.span: PLEASE NOTE THIS SECTION OF OUR WEBSITE IS STILL UNDER CONSTRUCTION

div.p:
Dear PSP Families,
We miss you and can’t wait to see you again! We love looking at the pictures on Class Dojo of students learning and connecting with their teachers and friends.
Thank you to our entire community for rising to this challenge as we navigate this public health emergency together. For the safety and well-being of our entire community - our students, educators, and families are making sacrifices and taking on new responsibilities. And together we will get through this.
We recognize that we are all now entering a new normal of balancing work life and home life.

While we are working to provide as many options as possible for your children to continue with the opportunities they had during a regular school day, we want to reiterate that PSP parents now ultimately need to decide what works best for your family in terms of these additional new remote learning options. You and your child's physical and mental health are fundamentally most important to us. Please spend as much time as you need focusing on positive experiences and anxiety reducing activities while we navigate this school closure.
Please let us know how we can help and how we can improve on what we’re providing!

div.div: Need to re-connect to your student's account on Class Dojo? Text 202-489-1621
Need a computer or help accessing the internet? Text 202-489-1621 or submit an IT ticket.
Want us to send you a paper based workbook to do at your own pace at home? Send Ms. Crouch or Ms. Smith a Dojo.
Need help finding locations serving school breakfast and lunch? Visit coronavirus.dc.gov/mealsites

Need support with emergency housing or food for your family? Message any of our school based social workers- Ms. Lou, Mr. Coale, Ms. Barnes, Ms. Shannen, Ms. Maclin - on Class Dojo OR text 202-489-1621
